meanings.definition: A person who offers unsolicited advice or commentary.
meanings.sent1: The kibbitzer at the park always tells me how to play better.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor is a kibbitzer, always giving advice on how to decorate my house.
meanings.sent3: The kibbitzer in the office suggested I should organize my desk with color-coded folders.
meanings.sent4: She was like a kibbitzer on the sidelines, shouting instructions during the game.
meanings.sent5: The kibbitzer in the group chat never fails to share their opinions on everything.

meanings.definition: To offer unsolicited advice or commentary.
meanings.sent1: I tend to kibbitzer when my friends are discussing their problems.
meanings.sent2: Please don't kibbitzer about how I should manage my time.
meanings.sent3: He likes to kibbitzer about the best way to grill a steak, even though no one asked.
meanings.sent4: The radio host would kibbitzer on the latest news every morning.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't help but kibbitzer on the movie plot twist, spoiling it for everyone.
